Reviews.Title: Pretty good for an inexpensive tripod for non-professionals, but there's one problem
Reviews.Author: B. Wilson
Reviews.Content: The Sunpak 5200D (also called the 620-520D) seems fairly well constructed and fairly sturdy for a light, inexpensive tripod. The card that comes with the tripod states:* Limited lifetime warranty!* Three-way ultra smooth photo/video panhead* Quick release plate with video indexing pin* Panhead bubble level* Geared center column with tension adjustment* Body bubble level* Oversize 0.75" (19 mm) leg diameter* D-shape three-section legs with flip lever leg locks and heavy-duty self-leveling rubber feet* Leg braces for added stability on uneven surfaces* Extends to a full 52" (132 cm)* Closes to only 20.5" (52 cm)* Holds up to 3.3 lb (1.5 kg)* Weighs just 1.8 lb (0.8 kg)For my flash camcorder I found that the Sunpak 5200D tripod could be quite stable for shooting videos. (I didn't fully extend the center post, so I was using the tripod at a height of about 50".) The quick release plate was firmly held in place. My problem with it was that it was not "ultra smooth."  Whenever I wanted to pan or tilt the camera there was an initial jerk to break the friction to get the motion started. I tried spraying it with silicone spray but that didn't help much. I even tried using a screwdriver to spread the joint but that didn't help either. I would have been quite pleased with this tripod except for that problem. Maybe the one I received was just from a bad batch.

Reviews.Title: good for the price
Reviews.Author: T. Clark
Reviews.Content: This is a nice quality light-weight tripod.  I bought mine from Woot for about the same price offered by Amazon (except for the additional shipping).Pros:light-weightsmooth solid movementspriceCons:not tall enough for meseems too light for heavy SLR cameras

Reviews.Title: Sunpak 620-520D (5200D) Tripod
Reviews.Author: techgurureviews
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2D096JLYL7TGC', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2D096JLYL7TGCloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2D096JLYL7TGCcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2D096JLYL7TGCcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 6:52 MinsThis is my review of the Sunpak 620-520D (more commonly known as the 5200D) 52" Tripod reviewThis is a great tripod, and i have had it for about 4 weeks now, and after active usage, there isnt a single scratch, it is a VERY nice tripod for the price you are getting it for, and if you are considering a tripod, you might want to consider this one!I would like to thank Sunpak Products and MyBatterySupplierSUNPAK[...]MyBatterySupplier[...]

Reviews.Title: excellent buy!  excellent value!
Reviews.Author: Mark J. Drejza "ROTLK Fan"
Reviews.Content: Simply put, for the price, you cannot go wrong.  I didn't buy it on Amazon, but I intend to get another one from here.  The quick release platform is excellent for staying attached to your camera or camcorder for quick switching between tripod and handheld.  The height is just right for most anything, and the screw mechanism, tilt and pan capability is pretty smooth...smooth enough for the home videographer.  Collapses and sets up very easily and quickly.  Makes a great gift.

Reviews.Title: Solid Tripod For The Bucks - 4 Stars
Reviews.Author: Michael Brent Faulkner, Jr. "Brent Faulkner"
Reviews.Content: The Sunpak Sunpak 5200D Tripod 620-520D is a relatively inexpensive lightweight tripod for digital cameras and video cameras. The tripod is indeed lightweight, weighing a nearly inconsequential 1.8 lbs. Sunpak describes this tripod as being 'designed to be a sturdy, rugged, and dependable product [that] will provide...many years of reliable service.' To back-up their assertion, Sunpak provides a one year limited warranty, which suggests repair/replacement, at the company's discretion. In addition to being equipped with the tripod itself (well packaged within plastic mind you), the package includes a simple operating instructions pamphlet, which details the tripod components and how to use those components effectively.The tripod is everything that it claims to be. Sturdy as described, this tripod put my economy-based Targus TG-42TT 42-Inch 8-Section Travel Tripod to shame. the tripod felt extremely 'grounded' given the tandem of leg brace, flip leg lock, and rubber foot. The height is a pro, extending to a maximum of 52" and a minimum of 19".  Having experimented with the maximum height taking a picture with a digital camera from a distance, the portrait was more than effective.Other sound features include a well designed geared center column, which adds to the stability and endurance of the device.  The Elevator crank is a coveted feature, something much more expensive tripods sport.  It is effective in extending the height beyond the constraints of the legs, epitomizing the soundness of this tripod.Overall, the Sunpak Sunpak 5200D Tripod 620-520D may have been my favorite 'Black Friday' investment.  It easily outclassed my previous tripod and saved me, am amateur photographer/videographer/enthusiast from investing more money.  A professional would probably nitpick, but assuming this would more suit an amateur, more often than not they should easily be pleased for the bucks.  4 stars.

Reviews.Title: Sunpak 620-520 52" lightweight tripod
Reviews.Author: Christine
Reviews.Content: Good compact lightweight tripod for traveling.  Fit into my 22" carry-on suitcase diagonally perfectly(not sure how it would fare in a checked bag).  A little stiff to pull out the legs to full length. Height was fine for me (I'm 5'2"). Used with my 35mm Canon T1i while in Maui in Feb. Worked quite well on flat and non-flat surfaces providing you are holding the tripod or camera in windy conditions.  You can leave it on its own if there is no wind and it's on a flat surface.  It was definitely helpful in Maui for use with the telephoto lens to help with stability in shooting whale shots from the lookout points.  Fair price for the product.  Will take again on another trip.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with my purchase!
Reviews.Author: Daisy N.
Reviews.Content: i was looking for a tripod, not too expensive but i didn't want one that would break in a couple days. this tripod was exactly what i was looking for! and for $14?! that's amazing! it got to me on the estimated delivery date so that's a plus. and was shipped in a box within a box wrapped nicely and all.PROS:- extended all the way I don't even have to bend over to look through the viewfinder- folds to the perfect size for me to put in my camera bag- my canon t3 fits perfectly, very sturdy and secure on it- a level measure to make sure your pictures are straight- light weight but not tooo flimsy- the clamps and crank work great and easily!CONS:- not as smooth when moving the camera around on the tripod. it's kinda choppy so that'll be noticeable if focusing on videos- the legs are pretty thin when extended all the way so im careful not to accidentally kick it or bump into it. if i did it'll most likely collapseEDIT: after a little while of having this tripod I regret getting such an essential accessory for a bargain. you get what you pay for. i'm very careful with my camera gear but having this tripod break on me was inevitable. a piece of plastic around one of the screws broke off and it basically caused every part of the tripod to stop working accordingly as well. i can't turn the tripod smoothly at all to the point where i would rather literally pick up the whole tripod to turn it in the direction i want. the top extension of the head won't remain in the position i want and can barely hold my Canon T3 with a 55-250 lens without it shaking and moving during a long exposure shot. and i will say a t3 is VERY light compared to other cameras and the 55-250 isn't even a pound. i don't even use this tripod with my other heavier lenses cause i'm afraid the whole thing will just collapse! at first i thought this was a good purchase but even if you're a beginning photographer looking for a tripod to experiment with i suggest you go with something a little bit more expensive as you will not regret it in the long run. i changed this form 4 stars to 2

Reviews.Title: cheaply made product
Reviews.Author: kristy jaya
Reviews.Content: I wanted a light weight tripod that would fit in my back pack .  This tripod will do that.  However the handle that raises the center of the tripod is made of very thin and cheap plastic. I feel sure it will break after a few uses.  It weighed it in at 2 lbs.  I would sent it back, but the postage is almost as much as the item.  So I guess I'll be using my 3lb. Vivitar tripod, which is very well made and will also fit in my back pack.  I would not recommend  this item to anyone, no matter how inexpensive it is.  When the handle breaks, it will be worthless.

Reviews.Title: fine for small camera
Reviews.Author: Ann from Mass
Reviews.Content: Thin legs. Held my Sony  hcs 3 ok but 52 in wasn't high enough  even with the extention  crank. But ok.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the Money
Reviews.Author: Dabber
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace a broken tripod.  It is of better quality than my last one.  For the money, I think that this is a very good buy for home/personal use.  I would definitely buy this again.  I am very pleased with this tripod and its construction quality and it works very well for my use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Bruno
Reviews.Content: I didnt know to buy it or not, because some reviews said it was fragile, but it is not. At first I was disappointed because I saw the tripod too short, but when you start to expand it, it is really long, and very lightweight. For $15 has exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, sturdy base, flimsy head
Reviews.Author: I. Bloch "BigdogNJ"
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a tripod that I could easily strap on to my camera bag and carry around when hiking or otherwise hunting for photo/video opportunities. The Sunpack fills the bill as far as being lightweight, but the head is so poorly made as to make the tripod extremely difficult to use except under the most basic of conditions.First, the pan head will not come to a full horizontal position according to the built in bubble levels. In order to level the camera with the horizon, you need to adjust the leg length on one side. Second, when tilting the camera to vertical, the head tilts far (a good 7 or 8 degrees) past the perpendicular. The way the locking mechanism works makes it very difficult to hold and lock the camera in  place to compensate for this.The head motions are too jerky to make this an effective video tripod except where a completely stationary camera is needed. This tripod is probably going to end up being used as a background light stand.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: ryan24
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tripid at $14.99 from amazon.  So pleased with it, although it is bit less sturdy than I'd like but very very mobile & light.  As others have mentioned the head is a little difficult to pan smoothly with but once you get the feel for it you can work with it no problem, there's lots of fine adjustments for how easily things rotate etc.For the price you can't go wrong, I plan on using this for timelapse shots so it's perfect for me.  Get it!

Reviews.Title: Extra care needed
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: I received this tripod when I purchased my camera. It's a nice lightweight design that fits on the camera backpack I received as well. There were a few annoyances, mostly I think because this is not meant for the SLR camera weight, the adjustable head on it wouldn't hold it's position for long before it started collapsing down. I tightened the screws as much as I could without thinking I'd strip the threads or break it, which ironically enough did cause me to break it. Because I was new to the tripod and I hadn't thought about the fact I tightened the adjustable height screw of the head, when I tried to lower it with the plastic crank attached the retaining part broke with little resistance/feedback to let me realize my mistake. I'll be looking for a replacement with a metal crank piece and with more weight capacity.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: tika
Reviews.Content: its too light and i hate i bought it. maybe it will be useful another time but not now. the legs are easy to bend out of shape too. so beware of that.

Reviews.Title: It works and it was cheap
Reviews.Author: Xtian
Reviews.Content: VERY light weight to the point where it's too light for me. It concerns me as far as stability. For the price I'm definitely not complaining, if I had paid more I would have expected more. The knob that turns/folds to lift the camera mount up and down is pretty cheap. I'm already worried it's going to break off and I just got it. Everything else is just OK. This would be good for maybe a beginner or if your going to be taking it to the beach or in the water where you don't want to ruin your nicer one. I am a beginner, so I just want to get my foot in the door until I know what equipment I want so this was perfect for that. The tripod looks good and the color is a nice flat black. It folds away nicely, very compact.

Reviews.Title: Grrr8!
Reviews.Author: Old Codger
Reviews.Content: Like everything about this pod. Purchased to hold a spotting scope while zeroing new rifles and rifle scopes and target practicing. Holds a very substantial 50 power spotting scope steadily with no worries about instability or falling over. Also very steady in the wind.Really like the feature that lets you mount the scope to a quick release mounting block that lets you pull the scope off and remount it quickly and easily without having to go through the trouble of unscrewing and screwing the scope onto the base every time. Versatile enough to easily and quickly use it sitting, crouching, or standing.Sturdy, while still being compact and light weight. Full of great features and extremely easy to set up, use, take down and store. Just wish it came with a carry bag (what the heck!).Can't believe it cost so little for what you get!

Reviews.Title: I like it!
Reviews.Author: djchrisobrien
Reviews.Content: I need a lightweight tripod to pack up into the mountains. I am a bit of a minimalist when it comes to the backcountry and my camera equipment is certainly the heaviest of all the stuff I pack. I use this with the new Nikon d5100 for alpenglow shots at between 12,000-14,000 feet. Lightweight and tuff enough to handle the Weminuche. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Value for money...
Reviews.Author: raja_kolkata
Reviews.Content: I don't know how long will it last but overall I'm satisfied. The guy who uploaded the prodcut video did a good job (thanks). I have used it just for twice and it is more than ok (for my Fujifilm Finepix S4000 which is more than 20 oz or 500 gms). As long as it is less than $15 its a value for money (no doubt). The only drawback is, it should have come with a normal carry case for which I would have been ready to pay $3 more (max).Caution - Screwing & unscrewing the camera from the (detachable) plate is slightly tricky as it is not mentioned properly in the manual (but this is not a disadvantage, you need to learn).Lastly its a value for money only if it lasts for couple of years.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight, small...
Reviews.Author: Paul M. Provencher "ppro"
Reviews.Content: This tripod would be perfect for small point and shoot cameras and as a stand for small strobes.I put this on my wish list and received it as a gift from my kids.  I wanted it as a stand for a optically triggered flash.  Light stands can be expensive and sometimes heavy.  I just needed something small and compact that didn't cost a lot of money and would support a few ounces.  This item works perfectly for that purpose.I have found it also supports my Panasonic Lumix DMC-TS2 14.1 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with 4.6x Optical Image Stabilized Zoom with 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue) perfectly.This is not a very rugged item, and would not survive rough handling very well.  But using it carefully as a strobe stand, I am pretty sure I will be more than happy.I would not recommend this for large DSLR's or any device that weighs more than a couple pounds.  I am sure it would blow over with a good gust of wind.  It might be a good option for backpacking since it's light, but it would probably need to be strapped onto the outside of a pack because it's small but not THAT small!

Reviews.Title: TRIPOD !!! GOOD DEAL !!!
Reviews.Author: Jose Galicia "okeylang_47"
Reviews.Content: IF YOU NEED AN IN-EXPENSIVE TRIPOD TO PUT YOUR VIDEO CAM OR DIGITAL CAMERA DON'T HESITATE TO BUY THIS ONE... MOST FUNCTIONALITY OF $20-$100 DOLLAR TRIPOD IS JUST SAME AS YOU CAN GET ON THIS ONE... THE ONLY DOWN SIDE IS THE PLASTIC PARTS... AND THAT'S ALL EXPECTED ON A LESS THAN 15 DOLLAR TRIPOD AND THEY ALL WORK JUST FINE... SO 5-STAR... ITS ALL WORTH IT...

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: rgibby
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tripod for work and it is great! I love the leveling feature and all the extensions work perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Tushar
Reviews.Content: A bit small, but honestly i got it for video and usage below eye level, its great very durable and super light weight , you cant go wrong with sunpak and it delivered so fast.i have faith in this tripod.

Reviews.Title: Good back-up, but not professional quality
Reviews.Author: D. Banks
Reviews.Content: I take this tripod travelling because it is conveniently light and short. It is too light-weight and too short for use in a studio.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tripod for the Price!
Reviews.Author: Wandering in Spain
Reviews.Content: We are beginning to shoot instructional recipe videos to post on our web site. We were told not to bother spending too much money on equipment and our editors recommended this Sunpak tripod because it was good quality and the right price.  That's absolutely spot-on! This tripod has everything we need as amateur photographers, plus it's lightweight and easy to use. We purchased it on sale on Amazon for less than $30USD, including shipping.

Reviews.Title: "Lightweight" means "flimsy" for this product
Reviews.Author: Robert Swindell "digital man"
Reviews.Content: The tripod works, but it's pretty flimsy and I'll be surprised if it lasts a year of regular use. I wouldn't recommend it unless weight (or lack thereof) is your highest priority.

Reviews.Title: Solid, inexpensive tripod for point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Danny Yu
Reviews.Content: I'm currently using a Sony WSC 290 for this tripod. Here are my experiences:- Support: although it does stand fairly strong, it does wobble when you're shifting the camera around.- User-friendly. I like the ease of use for the camera handles.- Appearance looks great. I love the black finish. It looks great and sleek.- Build is strong. Very sturdy and well built.- Unbeatable value. I was considering a couple of other tripods which were between $5-$10 more, but you don't really need it. This definitely is good for a point and shoot.Overall, I love it! Quality tripod.

Reviews.Title: Broken
Reviews.Author: William H Henderson
Reviews.Content: This tripod camera stand broke after its first use while trying to take it down.  A cheap plastic piece cracked.

Reviews.Title: A great tripod!
Reviews.Author: SkiGleek
Reviews.Content: This tripod works very well! It is extremely stable and well made. I use it mainly with my Nikon D3100 DSLR and Konica Minolta Maxxum film SLR.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Edward Ying
Reviews.Content: We used it hard on hikes, etc and one of the plastic fittings broke within 6 months.  Probably expected a little too much from it for a $15 tripod.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy
Reviews.Author: Mikey M.
Reviews.Content: I got this in a very secure packaging the same week I ordered it here in Indiana, and I really like it, it has the two great leveling bubbles, and it is built pretty well. I use it for my Kodak Playsport and my point and shoot which honestly are not that heavy, but It did handle my cousin's massive DSLR camera, so yeah this thing is great for the price. Its made out of metal and pretty strong plastic, and I really like the neat adjustment features and capabilities such as the extending base thats also releasable. I highly recommend it if you need one of these for less than $20.

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price!
Reviews.Author: Bookman Bruce "Loves To Review!"
Reviews.Content: This is fantastic -- this is so worth the price of purchase.  It is easy to set up, very sturdy for what it is and very flexible!  Don't expect a professional stand -- you can wing this thing around -- but you won't find a better one at this price!Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Linda Mulligan
Reviews.Content: This item was ordered for one of our department and as far as I know they are satisfied with it!

Reviews.Title: Adequate for an amateur like me
Reviews.Author: D. Kong
Reviews.Content: I need a tripod to mount my Panasonic camera so I can shoot some pictures of my model and wargame figures that I painted. This tripod is light and easy to use.  However, the washer for the lever that adjusts the angle of the mount came off when I was adjusting it during a shooting session. It's in a hard to reach area, but it wasn't a big deal as I put it back on after 2 tries. For a non-professional like me.  This tripod is adequate and gets the job done.

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Tristan Nardi
Reviews.Content: The first day I had it, the handle broke it was pretty cheaply made. The rest of it was not too bad just the handle on it was cheap plastic.

Reviews.Title: Great projector tripod for the price
Reviews.Author: Jim Carnicelli
Reviews.Content: I bought this to support an Apple TV and Optoma PK320 Pico Projector assembly (held together by a Joby GorillaPod) for my mobile theater. At $12, this cheap tripod is doing a great job. It has a quick release and the usual degrees of freedom.This is a lightweight, to be sure -- which is what I wanted. I might use it with my Nikon D60 or as a flash stand sometime, but I would't recommend using this with a heavier camera or if you need a steady tripod for video work.Incidentally, the Apple TV box doesn't have a mounting screw terminal like cameras do, so I had to improvise. I had an old metal piece from a small tripod that had cork pad built in, so I gorilla-glued it to the bottom of the Apple TV. Surprisingly, it hasn't snapped off yet. So the stack is: tripod > Apple TV > GorillaPod > pico projector.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the money
Reviews.Author: Big Daddy
Reviews.Content: I read a lot of reviews and decided to buy this and I am very pleased with my purchase,well made and was a very good price.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: Erik Rios
Reviews.Content: This tripod does what its suppose to do. Its lightweight which is great when I go out for hikes. It has great features such as the the panel movement, the rotation of the camera to shoot at a 90 degree angle. The only problem is that it is not really sturdy. It shakes with small winds.The tripod eventually broke on me. I did not deduct the two stars because of that. Only because I knew it would. It lasted a long time actually. It just had to break down sometime.I would recommend this if you want a cheap tripod, but be aware, its not professional quality.

Reviews.Title: Still in disbelief
Reviews.Author: B. Brown "Just me"
Reviews.Content: I don't have any photography experience and this is my first tripod, but I don't understand how they can sell this for so cheap. The adjustments seem sturdy and it does everything I would want it to. the pan handle is very nice and I've used it several times already. Well worth the money and I don't see how you could go wrong with this tripod, even if you have an expensive camera.

Reviews.Title: Light and Full featured
Reviews.Author: Are you KIDDING??
Reviews.Content: Not as tall as I wished but, for the money, it's perfect.  Nice smooth everything.Well made.Some comment that it's flimsy.  It's fairly sturdy for it's weight.  Think about it, it's made out of real light aluminum tubing.If you want 40lb Bogen,  do so and get that stable tripod.  But for, on the go, this is as ideal as it gets in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Its Cheap
Reviews.Author: James Patrick
Reviews.Content: I picked up two just for the head for a project I'm working on.. It is cheap and but it works

Reviews.Title: Brittle plastic
Reviews.Author: N/A
Reviews.Content: It may just be the run I got but the plastic is very brittle.The first time I used it, a screw popped right through the plastic when tightened. The next time I picked it up, one of the arms that comes out of the main shaft and connects to the legs was broken.  It hadn't even been touched for a week.I would have returned it but the box got thrown out. I was worried that it would be a bit junky at this price but it really surprised me. I'd say that it's as close as they could get to selling a tripod made of cardboard and tape.

Reviews.Title: Great basic tripod at an amazing price
Reviews.Author: TheProfessor
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great tripod. It works well, is sturdy, and has a quick release plate that is effortless. Professionals are going to want a taller tripod, a ball head for speedy micro adjustments, more metal, and perhaps a center unipod; but this is a perfectly acceptable tripod at an amazing price. I keep these in the trunk of my cars and have used it not only for spot news but also for professional shoots when other tripods have broken. Buy two, at this price it is worth it if you only need a second release plate.After one of my orders, I had to contact the seller (Sunpak) and they were responsive and friendly.

Reviews.Title: After some use
Reviews.Author: JonTheCanadian "CanadianJon"
Reviews.Content: The price is cheap, but so is the build. It's only really good for setting up a static shot and then letting it sit still. If you want anything else - buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Get it for indoor or outdoor with no wind
Reviews.Author: Joseph
Reviews.Content: Get it for indoor or outdoor with no windIt’s a nice oneWell finishedGood heightBut has a plastic headAlso the bubble thing is not accurate

Reviews.Title: Really not bad at all
Reviews.Author: Senpai
Reviews.Content: I like the black with the 5200D printed on it. Very light weight and easy to setup. Just don't like the foot pads too much, I'm just waiting for the day one snaps off

Reviews.Title: It is a $12 tripod... what do you expect?
Reviews.Author: John Strada
Reviews.Content: Ok, this tripod is very very good for $12... It has a nice matte finish and the parts are well made, the box in which came in is very good if  you don't have a bag for it yet. It is not the sturdiest of them all, but it is really good, it does it's job. You will have a fully stiff and sturdy tripod at maybe 40-45 inches, if you extend it all, it will be a little bit loose.Why do I give 5 stars then? well... because it is just $12. If you want a super tripod, then you have to be spending more money than $12.... I really can't stand people who:1) whine because it does not have the quality of a $200 Manfrotto tripod while paying only $122) Use it like it is a heavy duty piece of equipment, then break any part of it and then blame the company...EDIT! 04-10-2013Ok, so... I kinda understand a few bad reviews for this tripod which I criticised in the first place..I have used the tripod 5 times max in the past month, the knob for you to adjust the height of the platform just broke, without even using it, I just wanted to use it and I realised that the plastic ripped appart. Also, the hinge for one of the feet broke also... Just like that, if you look at the tripod, you will find a new one, but if you look closely, you wouldn't believe it...  It is plastic, but looks like play doh.

Reviews.Title: Broke since the first use.
Reviews.Author: P.M.
Reviews.Content: The adjustment hop was broken since the first time I touched it, but I can't return or get it replaced it because it passed the return period already. It was such a bad luck because I didn't have a chance use it within the returning period. And I can't tell from the outside that it's broke!I trusted Amazon and always buy from Amazon. Amazon should provide a better service for its customer.

Reviews.Title: Good product
Reviews.Author: LRTV
Reviews.Content: I bought this tripod for a family gift, is lightweight, easy to carry and a very economical price to make some photo images and video. It is important to note that being so light can only be used for amateur photography.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Works well enough. Just can't seem to figure out how to tighten the knob that keeps it from moving up and down so easily. Maybe it's just me though.

Reviews.Title: rubish
Reviews.Author: boblawblah
Reviews.Content: This tripod is worth using while you save up for a better one but bear in mind that is all it is good for. Once the bit that goes up and down( I don't know the name of it obviously) stopped working I took it apart to find that it has weak plastic, kind of like a long cog, turning the metal post with grooves in it. This critical part was stripped completely smooth. They must have made it this way to  guaranty that it would wear out because making this one piece out of metal couldn't raise the cost more than a few cents. I would have gladly payed an extra dollar or 2 for that simple change.

Reviews.Title: Christmas Present
Reviews.Author: CNDiggs
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a present for a very critical person. Then next time I saw them they were carring it and telling someone else how great it was!

Reviews.Title: Sufficient
Reviews.Author: Tony in Houston
Reviews.Content: I would've given it a 4 star but the levels were slightly off; the round level is centered but the horizontal level was off but leveled as I rotated the camera.  Constructions is fair, not extremely sturdy but no flimsy either.  But for just $10, I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Meyers "Jeff"
Reviews.Content: I'm thinking that because cameras have gotten considerably smaller and lighter, tripods are following suit. The trouble is, you want a tripod to be sturdy, stable and functional. I bought it for my daughter's Flip camera and a Panasonic V100K. Even with the small cameras the tripod is wobbly and unsure and these are small cameras. The crank on the unit slips and clicks preventing you from getting smooth motion out of it. It seems cheaply produced and of low quality. I'm disappointed and will be looking into how I can return it.

Reviews.Title: great tripod for a great price
Reviews.Author: Raul Martinez
Reviews.Content: This tripod has great  stability with helpful levels to help you keep your pictures straight and leveled. I love this tripod and the orice too.

Reviews.Title: Pretty poor quality - get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: D. Coconuts
Reviews.Content: I got this when it was on sale here and saw it had pretty good reviews.I set it up to use and noticed it would not hold my camera steady, so I looked at it closely and saw that one of the adjusters was broken, and the other two were just not doing their jobs.I went to return it, and realized I got it so cheap that I couldn't have expected anything else. Why spend hundreds of dollars on equipment and then get cheap when it comes to a stand? Lesson learned.

Reviews.Title: Good buy
Reviews.Author: S. Opperthauser "SO"
Reviews.Content: Light, compact, and easy to use.  Great for traveling, hiking, etc.  Good deal if you are looking for a cheap tripod.

Reviews.Title: Flimsy.
Reviews.Author: Chris Brandt
Reviews.Content: This tripod is cheap and it feels cheap. The handle broke off so i have to manhandle it to get it to go up and down... do yourself a favor... spend the extra cash and get a more solid tripod.. Also sunpak makes some really good ones.

Reviews.Title: Great for value.
Reviews.Author: highjinxandrables
Reviews.Content: It's great for casual use. Nothing fancy, just a basic tripod. Gets the job done and gives me a lot of options when it comes to height.

Reviews.Title: great price
Reviews.Author: National LLC "J Allen"
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how good this is for the price. you can't go wrong. used this many times and bought an additional one.

Reviews.Title: Light tripod
Reviews.Author: Shopper
Reviews.Content: Pretty good and light tripod.  As you'd expect, it's not as sturdy as you'd get with a heavy one.  But it's a good choice for hiking/traveling.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not that great.
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Honestly this is my first tripod and I really needed one to help with my photography.  This tripod is by no means a quality tripod.  It was cheap though so I can't expect that much.  It feels a bit flimsy and cheap.  It does work but does still allow for movement, so a remote or timer would be a good idea to use if your subject allows.  Overall it works and looks well, it's not heavy, or at least I don't think so.  Hey, for you price you can't do much better, it has some neat features as well.

Reviews.Title: Sunpak Sunpak 5200D Tripod
Reviews.Author: Han Vo
Reviews.Content: It shipped on time and packed nicely. Easy to open and set up. I thought the height is perfect to take group pictures. It's light to carry around, and I have a lot of fun with it!

Reviews.Title: happy with the purchase
Reviews.Author: MRR "MRR"
Reviews.Content: tripod is good and serves my needs.it comes with only one attachment, i have 2 cameras and it is pain to change every time.it would have been better if there was a carrying case/bag.

Reviews.Title: Very cheaply made
Reviews.Author: M. A. Kozo
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a really cheap tripod for my DSLR camera, and this was definitely not one that I should have gotten. I understand wanting to believe that it will work due to the cheap price, but honestly, I would recommend spending more on a better tripod. This one is very wobbly and feels pretty cheaply made. Many of the knobs on the tripod feel like they could break off with the slightest misuse.For reference, I tried using this tripod with the D3100. Next time, I will definitely spend a bit more on a better tripod, because this one will not work for much.

Reviews.Title: GREAT!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Rodgers
Reviews.Content: very GREAT!! this item looks and seem to be holding up very well very nice to travel with and to go hiking with. its great to be able to put it on rocks and looking back and to see in the same position with out it falling over like another tripod i had until i saw this one it looks great and seem to be great so far thanks again... :D

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Lincey
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed of the quality for the price. I have shopped online for a long time before deciding to buy this Sunpak tripod and I'm very very happy with my purchase. This tripod is stable and perfect for my needs ( I needed a stable one to be able to take good pictures of products without the flash ).

Reviews.Title: Not What I hoped For:  Sunpak 5200D Tripod
Reviews.Author: R. Poole
Reviews.Content: I guess for the price it is okay to use with a light-weight camera. It is made of relatively thin plastic except for the 3 aluminum legs...Not very stable fully extended.  The product info says it will hold up to 3.3 lbs. but that is not accurate.  The adjustable head won't hold in position even 2 lbs. for long before it starts collapsing down; and turning the handle more to tighten it will cause the screw threads to be stripped.

Reviews.Title: Seriously Good Tripod!!!
Reviews.Author: Joe User
Reviews.Content: This tripod has everything you could want (sight levels, pivoting heads, removable base, very light). Also, this tripod is pretty sturdy considering its weight. I use this with a Canon SX40HS and overall it works well. For the money, you can not buy a better tripod!

Reviews.Title: GREAT PRICE; good product
Reviews.Author: nwbumb
Reviews.Content: We bought an olumpus vr320 camera from amazon; it was time too get a tripod; looked @ wal mart, and this BY far, was the best deal I could find. unpackaged it and wow, I and my 2 children were impressed! Thanks again, Amazon for suiting our needs!

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: BostonProfessionalDad
Reviews.Content: Extremely lightweight, for better or worse. Seems sturdy for the price. Easily adjustable. I'm sure there are better tripods but I'm happy this was a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Unicorn Power!
Reviews.Author: Everest Hillary
Reviews.Content: For how much I paid for this, I feel like I got away with Grand Theft Auto. Its a heck of a bargain and perfect for hiking or other activity where the fact that its lightweight comes in handy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tripod
Reviews.Author: leelee
Reviews.Content: Light, yet sturdy and well constructed tripod. Includes vertical/horizontal angles, bubble level and telescoping legs. Camera mount plate is easy to remove and reattach securely. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: Debasmit
Reviews.Content: This is a great tripod. Lightweight to easily carry it around and has all the functionalities of expensive ones.Also has bubble indicator unlike another Sunpak tripod which costs a few bucks more.The first one I ordered had a problem with the bubble indicator, so I sent it back and got another one from Amazon whose bubble works fine.I have not seen how tall it can grow, but just extending the legs makes it almost 5ft. Then you can extend the neck further. Not exactly sure what the max. height is,but solves my purpose.It looks great too, with the matte black finish.The quick release pan-head is excellent.And you can move the camera in x-y-z direction. And you simply can't beat the price!The only problem is that since its a little lightweight, I am not sure of the stability. It can hold my camera(Canon SX30IS) fine.But I have not tested it in very windy weather.If you have a very heavy camera with a huge zoom lens,you might think of going for a little expensive one which have provision for hanging weights to increase stability(this one doesn't).Also,I am an amateur photographer and do not have any experience with tripods.So,a little manual which says what all the knobs are meant for might have helped.But it might just be only me.Overall,I like the product very much.

Reviews.Title: i'm please with this item
Reviews.Author: LinaW
Reviews.Content: This is my first tripod and I choosed the unexpensive one with the good rating. So I couldn't say much about the quality of this item, but for $15.00 I can be in my families pic now, thats for sure :)Thank you for all the comments that help me to find the right tripod.

Reviews.Title: Sunpak 620 52" Tripod
Reviews.Author: ernie6
Reviews.Content: Very good tripod for the price.  OK for light cameras.  The pan/tilt adjusters should lock tighter, but are OK for stationary camera use.  No problems to date (1 month's use.)

Reviews.Title: Low Price and High Quality
Reviews.Author: Consumer Advocate
Reviews.Content: I have used a Sunpak tripod with good experience more than 30 years ago, so I decided to buy the same brand to see what a $15 Sunpak tripod looks like.Amazingly, it has quite a few useful features:1. Detachable tripod plate.2. Adjustable leg pad angle.3. Bubble level.4. Leg brace.All this in a $15 tripod?I have all praises and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: TJ
Reviews.Content: Does its tripod duties pretty well. Nice and lightweight, but still strong enough to hold a camera that weighs several pounds.

Reviews.Title: not too good.
Reviews.Author: Josue Recinos "manifesto"
Reviews.Content: well... i wasnt expecting much from this tripod...but i was very disapointed. its craftmanship is very cheap and almost toy like feautre. im almost afraid to touch it. dont think to take this out for shooting, as it looks more like a toy... the only use ive found for it is for shooting object in my garage. but as far as going out on trips with it and stuff like that.. nah.. took it out once and i must say i was embarassed to be seen with it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent for the price
Reviews.Author: jfrank91
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality tripod for the money. Fits my Olympus PEN without any sort of an issue. The body and legs of the tripod are made of metal and feel sturdy. The feet are adjustable and made of thick rubber (some of the nicest ones I've seen, even on more expensive models). The only complaint I have is that the crank to raise and lower the camera is made of very thin plastic and feels pretty chintzy. Good product and super quick shipper.

Reviews.Title: Great tripod for the money!
Reviews.Author: MountainMan
Reviews.Content: Awesome tripod for the money!! However, if you are using it for any kind of hiking/backpacking make sure you put the quick release plate in your pack! I didn't and a branch must have caught the lever releasing the plate to be lost forever (which is the only reason I gave it a 4/5). I could only find 1 site that sold a replacement plate, and they said it would take 2 months for it to arrive. On top of that they wanted to charge me the same amount of money for a whole new tripod. Wound up ordering a new one from amazon, and this time I plan on putting the quick release plate in my pack.

Reviews.Title: Great for beginners, worth the price and more...
Reviews.Author: Rinchen
Reviews.Content: If you are a beginner, and barely got into photography, this is the Tripod you want to buy. This is sturdy enough for casual hikes for landscape photography, good for long exposure try outs and for usual portraiture etc.It helps one in understanding the lingo, technical aspects of choosing the right tripod and finally going to that big purchase of a amateur or professional level tripod.I would never like to venture into a photo gear shop as a newbie with no idea of what I want in my Tripod. Tripod should be an investment, an investment that is quite significant in terms of money spent, therefore I would rather invest right one time than again and again, unless of course you have all that money to spend. This tripod makes you comfortable about doing that ultimate investment of a costlier tripod.

Reviews.Title: I broke in 2 weeks
Reviews.Author: Kallison
Reviews.Content: Obviously when you buy a tripod for under $20 you get a tripod that is worth under $20.  Done purchase it

Reviews.Title: Nice but a little heavy
Reviews.Author: W. Teo
Reviews.Content: If weight is not your concern, then this tripodis very sturdy and works nicely.  If weight isa problem, then don't touch it.  It's bulky.

Reviews.Title: Not for DSLR!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Tried using the it in the vertical position today and plate came off even though it was locked... good thing I had my hand on the camera strap.  I was using a heavier than average body (the Nikon D200), but the smallest lightest lens around (Nikkor 50mm 1.8). I would not trust this tripod for any dslr.  I have used it a bunch in the pass for a point and shoot, and a small digital camcorder, but both of those where not mounted vertical.  Hope this helps.  Don't skip on a tripod, you may have to replace a camera.

Reviews.Title: Garbage
Reviews.Author: blackheart
Reviews.Content: Do not waste your time on this.  I had it for 5 minutes and broke it.  It is too flimsy and not sturdy.

Reviews.Title: no correct information
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: the owner told they did not have the item available after one week since I placed my order, they should upgrade their item.

ProductInfo.Features:
Folded Height: 20.5"
Extended Height: 52"
Weight Capacity: 3.3 Lbs
3-Way Panhead With Quick Release
1-Year Warranty
Weight Capacity: 3.3 Lbs.
ProductInfo.Name: Sunpak SPK620520D 52-Inch Lightweight Tripod
